page.title: 17ST BERNARD'S CATHOLIC CHURCH
page.content: Fr Thomas Hannon has lived for one year in Knott End where he has been parish priest of St Bernard's Church which was built in 1922. In an interview he said that most church goers are over 50 but that a lot of children also come to church. About 220 people come to church each week and more come than did two years ago. The oldest parishioner is 94 and many young people want to be ministers but not any girls. He said that he didn't know whether more people were joining the church, but once a month he meets with clergy of other faiths and churches and he has a strong wish for church unity. He said that most people there had lived hard lives and were enjoying retirement in a good community. He said that he would like to get the people who had stopped coming to church to come back again.
